headline: Amazing team
pros:
Bukalapak is a great place to grow. There are so many new opportunities being explored within technology and product.
The people at Bukalapak are some of the most caring and kind people I've met.
cons: There is probably more work than people within technology.

headline: Great work life balance and innovative!
pros:
- Work-life balance is really great
- The team is also really great, no drama whatsoever
- Innovative, keen on doing new businesses and have great ambitions to always grow the company
- Have a lot of sessions for mental health, finance and accounting, etc for employees
- Benefit is quite ok (relatively speaking)
cons:
- A lot of people are quite slow response, and sometimes they don't really want to get involved or answer your questions (prepare to be pingpong-ed)
- Had a case when I needed their help in explaining about tax, but they didn't really help. Also, if you move to the company from somewhere else in the middle of the year, please know that you will have to pay some money due to underpayment of taxes (they don't receive & continue tax calculations from the previous company)
- Dynamic environment, so can be quite challenging

headline: The company where there is real chance for you to pursue your passion
pros: The culture is pretty much result driven, means its good work life balance as long as your job is good.
cons: People in Buka generally polite, sometimes its pretty hard to understand critic's and point of improvement coming from certain team

headline: Great culture and innovative
pros: Working culture is very open and collaborative. People are generally willing to help one another even in a different function or leader. Willing to try innovative ideas and take calculated risks. It is ok to challenge one another respectfully including your boss if you have data to back your idea.
cons: Pace is quick like a typical tech company.

headline: Great culture
pros: great culture, open minded, never settling

industry challenges.

headline: Best Place to Grow
pros:
- I'm pretty lucky I'm assigned in a squad that has friendly environment. It's very flexible thanks to WFH policy. 
- There's a huge opportunity to grow. There are so many internal programs to push your skill to the limit.
- I have awesome teammates that really support my work. 
- The benefits are really good; BL has one of the best health insurance. 
- Engineer can actually push product if anything went wrong. Every voice is heard and feel like everyone has the power to change.
cons:
- We're still not a settle ground even as a unicorn. The movement inside is really fast, any initiative can change quickly. 
- While the product demand is increasing every time, the resource does not follow.

headline: Great place to work
pros:
- Very well paid
- Good colleagues, "Gotong Royong" is one of our core values
- There are many beneficial programs, for example, Laptop ownership program. With this program, we can get our dream Laptop for free (we pay this with our years of service). Also there is a House ownership program where we can get a lower interest when we want to take a KPR.
- WFO Optional (till now)
cons: Difficult to get promoted to senior level engineer, especially if you're not in the CORE teams.

headline: Gotong Royong & Learning Together
pros:
- The team are generally very helpful, rather than defensive from each other
- The compensation is relatively good, comparable with tier-1 Indo startups (Traveloka, Grab etc)
- There is a clear company growth and I imagine plenty of cash post the IPO, hence there has been a spike in hiring
- The career ladder is quite long which means everyone has opportunity to grow
cons: - As typical user of Bukalapak app is from 2nd tier cities, it may feel a little upsetting when none of your friends are using it

headline: Great place with many benefits

- Abundant resources for learning, not only technical wise but also business, culture and people.
- Flexible working time (with core hour setup)
- WFH, with optional WFO setup if needed.
- Decent benefit (salary, health insurance)
cons:
- A lot of changes in business development, sometime affecting various engineering OKRs and planning.
- A little bit unclear in career progression and standard.
- Too much rotation in middle managements.

headline: Good

headline: Great Environment
pros: Good work life balance, flexible hours, nice facilities, cozy offices and more. Lunch was also included on employment package, so it was super convenient.
cons: Though my teammates were great, unfortunately, I had a supervisor that did too much of a nepotism. Besides massively recruiting own close relatives to the team, toxicity started to grow because 'they' intervened private matters of other co workers and frequently reporting it to the supervisor. Unpleasant and unprofessional of a team.

headline: Pro cons working in one of the biggest tech company
pros: Fast Growing tech all commerce company in Indonesia, dare to be different, huge tolerance, good salary and compensation. Good talent team.
cons: The supporting tools, resources and work flow are not sufficient in terms of quality and quantity. Unclear direction, not aligned between each of division or top to down in the organization

headline: Bukalapak Company Review
pros:
One of the best companies I have worked for so far. I think Bukalapak invests a lot in their people, pay attention to employee's need, especially the medical benefit. Also, the people inside are kind and really supportive. I love key-value in Bukalapak. And also the salary is pretty competitive. And you will get another benefit like an annual bonus and THR.
If you're working from the office, you will get lunch too.
cons: Level up is never been easy, you need to fulfil a lot of qualifications and there is quota for it

headline: A Place to grow with non substantial technology decision
pros:
This is the place to grow as engineer. The surrounding folks are great. 
You can find a good Head and VP level here, to give you a good leadership coaching. 
In past 2 years, the load is quite packed and challenge also tough. But it makes you even better and experienced engineer / leader.
cons:
CTO in absentia makes this no longer a tech company, but a pure commerce driven company. 
Even if they have CTO, decision will still end up on both COO and CSO dynamic duo. This will make Head and VP level fight alone, even fight each other. 
Engineering culture also being a forgotten stuff.

headline: Grown-up company with interesting benefits

headline: The behemoth that is going down in quality
pros:
- Salary above average
- Medical benefit beyond the market average
- If you work here, you will have a good image on the market
- Free lunch (no dinner)
- Paid team dinner every 2 months
cons:
- not that flexible anymore (no remote working nor flexible working hour, even clothing is being ruled at)
- not that royal anymore (no lop, no conference, stricter employee loans)
- no clear direction from management, it changes a lot
- since mass layoffs, many are not motivated anymore, plenty of people leaving (some of them are the long-serving and talented ones)
- lots of new talented senior people from other great companies but more than half of them are pushy, cannot empathy, communicate nor cooperate well

headline: Best company to work as engineer in Indonesia
pros:
Generous paid leave/year
Very concerned about work-life balance, almost no overtime at all
Flexible working hours
Can do remote work if really needed
Competitive Salary
Health Assurance
Challenging environment (work with the best engineers in Indonesia)
Supported Individual Development Program (can go overseas to attend conferences)
Hands down the best company to work as engineer in Indonesia, truly magical place
cons: Size of the team grows too fast that the office started to get cramped, but no big deal at all

headline: A good place to work and learn new things
pros: Casual atmosphere when working, many free facility given to employee, work hard, play hard, paid Independent Development Program (Learn from conference, meetings etc)
cons: Need to start moving to bigger office

headline: Best workplace for engineer
pros: I have been working at Bukalapak full-time for less than a year, but I think the working environment here is really great, I love the opportunity to work with such a lot of talented engineer, and just like me, most of them are still young! We share a lot of great idea and vision, even our CEO is relatively young and he has a lot of vision for the future of the company and Indonesia. As for the method of our development team, we work in an agile environment. I have flexible working hours, can work remotely, great salary, friendly colleagues, and great office facilities (there's a fun room with billiard, Xbox, and Playstation), and the best thing for me is I can wear whatever outfit that I feel comfortable. Bukalapak also offers a lot of benefits that employers can use. I really recommend working here.
cons: New employee (as for me) might find it difficult to adapt to the working environment for the first time. There's a lot of things that already there that you have to learn first to be able to work something out. But the problem is, most of the senior developers are pretty busy with their own work, so there is no tutoring or anything, and you have to learn most of the thing by yourself. The documentation is there for you to learn, but it is not complete, so you really need to try kinds of stuff out.  And Right now, there are too many employees, with a small workplace. They really need a new office before hiring more employees.

headline: Very Good Work-Life Balance
pros:
- Very good work-life balance
- Free lunch and dinner
- Flexible working habit (you can do remote working anytime you need it, you can come to work and go back home at almost anytime)
- There are "guilds" for employees to learn specific subjects or knowledges
- Coworkers are very friendly compared to another companies, they're not only coworkers to you, but also real friends
- Clear career path & level
cons:
- The flexible working habit can drive employee to their comfort zone, and somehow can make them lazier from time to time
- Management-driven features

headline: Great Place to Start Your Career
pros:
- Work with the industry's, or even the region's top tier engineers
- Rockstar benefits
- Flextime, remote working available
- Gym and gaming rooms available
- Free lunch AND dinner
- Agile and impactful work
- Clear career progression for engineers
cons:
- Tech a bit outdated
- Hybrid Scrum development process calls for too many meetings
- As the company grows, it gradually loses its startup vibe
- Open office environment, great if you like it, nightmare if you don't
- If you work here you're gonna be constantly targeted by recruiters and headhunters trying to snatch you out
